meanings.definition: One who wheedles or persuades by flattery or smooth talk.
meanings.sent1: The wheedler convinced his friend to share his toys by complimenting him.
meanings.sent2: The politician was known as a skilled wheedler, always charming his way into people's hearts.
meanings.sent3: The wheedler at the party made everyone laugh with his clever jokes.
meanings.sent4: She was a master wheedler, able to sweet-talk her way out of any situation.
meanings.sent5: The wheedler's silver tongue could convince anyone to do anything.

meanings.definition: To influence or entice by soft words or flattery.
meanings.sent1: She tried to wheedle her way into getting a later curfew by promising to do extra chores.
meanings.sent2: The salesman attempted to wheedle the customer into buying the more expensive product.
meanings.sent3: He wheedled his sister into letting him borrow her favorite book by promising to return it in perfect condition.
meanings.sent4: The cat wheedled its way into the house by meowing pitifully at the door.
meanings.sent5: The child's puppy-dog eyes were enough to wheedle his parents into buying him a new toy.
